definition: good omen/good luck (in business etc)/profits (gained in gambling, lottery etc)
(bright) color/variety/applause/applaud/lottery prize
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns

sentences.english: He brought the company a good omen of a lot of money when he took over the position.
sentences.chinese: 他剛一上任就爲公司帶來了錢穀廣進的好彩頭。

sentences.english: Hotel design company opened the eighth day good luck.
sentences.chinese: 酒店設計公司初八開業好彩頭。

sentences.english: Go to resist a castle treasure-house, rend away now a time world the premier colourful head of general assembly.
sentences.chinese: 前往御殿寶庫，搶走今次天下第一武道大會的彩頭。

sentences.english: To win the respect of rival, is after appropriate point heat to the losers.
sentences.chinese: 贏得對手的尊重，就是得手後適當的反點彩頭給輸家。

sentences.english: They have also been publicity ornaments used by local officials to boost their standing.
sentences.chinese: 一些地方官員還利用這些宣傳彩頭來謀求職位升遷。

definition: to stay young forever
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
full moon/first full moon after birth (i.e. entering the second month)
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
Happy New Year
wedding night
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
bane of one's existence/vile spawn
red in the face/extremely angry
dejected/despondent/depressed
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
